item.description:
Have you ever been on an owl prowl? That’s a hike in the woods at night to listen for the hoots and wails and shrieks of owls! Join expert birder Glenn d’Entremont for an evening walk seeking the signs of our resident Great Horned Owls as well as the Saw-whet Owls who are moving into this area in great numbers right now.

Meet at Park Headquarters. Program is free and open to the public. Program is for adults. No dogs, please. Program is outdoors; be sure to dress warmly and wear good shoes. Rain and/or high winds will cancel; inclement weather date of Nov 6. Program co-sponsored by the Department of Conservation & Recreation and the Friends of Myles Standish State Forest. For more information, call Amy at (508) 272-9376. For park info and directions, visit www.mass.gov/dcr/parks/southeast/mssf.htm.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Evening Owl Prowl!
